The unit cell volume is sensitive to structural transition in
, i.e., it contracts when a ferroelectric-to-para-
contracts by 4.2% during the phase transition. Most
interestingly, the volume contraction increases with increase
in V content. The volume contraction value increases to 6.3%
contracts by a value as large as 10.4% at the ferroelectric-to-
paraelectric phase transition point. One of the main factors for
volume contraction in this series of compounds at the phase
transition is the change in bonding between Pb
O, which is discussed below. PTO-based composites with a
high value of volume contraction during phase transition can
give rise to interesting properties like high NTE. Moreover, a
temperature-induced phase transition is observed experimen-
So, it can be said that for higher amount of
The cubic structure of PVO can be considered as a special
case of ideal tetragonal perovskite with
ferroelectric polarization is very sensitive to structural
compositions accurately, we have calculated the total energy
. We have performed this calculation with a
2 supercell, which means we should get a minimum
= 2 for a cubic system. Consistent with this, our
paraelectric phase, whereas for the ferroelectric phase, we get a
. To ﬁnd the possible polarization path, we have
calculated the total energy as a function of Pb displacement
the easiest path of the ferroelectric polarization and the role of
Pb ions in the tetragonal distortion. We have plotted the
displacement of Pb ion with respect to VO
[111] and [001] directions. The energy versus displacement
curves for both the directions have double-well shapes. It can
be seen that the lowest energy for the oﬀ-center displacements
is along the [001] direction. It shows that the ferroelectric
properties are greatly eﬀected by the polarizability of Pb. The
energy diﬀerence between the two directions is very small
So, in principle, the Curie temperature of PVO must
be less than that of BiFeO
been estimated yet, as it decomposes before reaching to its
to be 823 K by Pan et al.,
and it showed an increasing trend
are in between 823 and 873 K). Compositions
We have also performed nudged elastic band (NEB)
calculations to ﬁnd out the energetics of ferroelectric-to-
paraelectric phase transition and to identify a minimum-energy
path for the phase transition. To calculate the minimum-energy
path, we have considered the tetragonal phase of PbVO
initial structure and the cubic phase as the tetragonal structure.
Diﬀerent intermediate images were created, and the energies
for all of the images were calculated considering the volume as
well as shape variation. The energies obtained are plotted
versus the images (here mentioned as reaction coordinates).
which shows that the ferroelectric-to-paraelectric transition
involves an energy barrier of 127 meV, which is higher than the
diﬀerence between the ground-state total energies of these two
70 meV. It also shows the V
polyhedra. In the case of ferroelectric phase, the V
polyhedron is highly distorted and makes a pyramidal
arrangement. The intermediate images along the FE-to-PE
transition path with higher energies than the FE phase possess
comparatively less distorted polyhedra. Finally, the end
product, i.e., the paraelectric phase, exhibits an undistorted
octahedron. The high energy barrier for the phase transition is
consistent with the high-temperature FE-to-PE phase tran-
compounds similar to PVO, i.e., BaTiO

value. The inset shows the octahedral
environment changes into pyramidal one due to increase in tetragonal
Total energy as a function of displacement of Pb ion along
the [001] and [111] directions for the ferroelectric PVO. Structural
relaxations were considered through selective dynamics.
